item.title: Dillon Baird Takes 1st Place at National Speech and Debate Championship
item.description: San Antonio, TX - Middle school student Dillon Baird has won first place in the category of public forum debate at the Speech and Debate National Championship, held in San Antonio, TX. Baird, a seventh grader at Desert Springs Middle School, competed against students from across the country in the public forum debate category. He won first place after delivering a series of compelling and well-argued speeches on a range of topics, including the role of government in healthcare, the ethics of genetically-modified foods, and the impact of technology on society.
